Journey is a scheduling app designed to help develop skills or make progress on personal projects.

Almost everyone at some point has tried to develop a skill but dropped it for one reason or another. Maybe because life got complicated and there wasn't enough time to pursue it. Maybe because you had a specific goal you were trying to reach but got discouraged on the way. Journey was designed to help keep you working on the skill and does so in two ways:


1. Daily activity checkmarks to encourage not skipping days. 

2. A change in perspective from trying to reach a goal, to trying to make progress.

1. Open the options menu in the top right of the main screen.
 2. Select the “Update Journeys” option.
 3. Select “New Journey”.
 4. Fill out the requested information and submit.
 5. Return to the main menu.


Every day that you meet your goal you can select that day and check it off. It is strongly encouraged to take a picture, video, or make a note of your progress for the day and attach it to the activity you just checked off as well. Once you get to the last day of your journey, a new option will appear on the main menu to look back on all the progress you have made based on the files you uploaded. If the day had extra significance such as reaching a milestone or doing particularly well, you can start the activity on that day to highlight it.

Although you can select any type of activity and set any type of goal per day, the following are some recommendations that may improve experience with the app. Pick activities that you have some way of recording progress such as drawing and attach each picture you draw, running and create a text file with the distance you ran, or music and record yourself playing. Keep the activities short so you can’t excuse yourself from it by thinking you don’t have time. Try to keep the activities to under 10 minutes. When selecting a period of time for the activity, choose a day far enough in the future that you will be able to see your improvement. Try 6 month or a year. If the activity involves a tool or location that you don’t always have access to, think of a backup action that would still help make progress with the skill such as reading guides, preparing gear, or making plans for the next time you do have access.

Hi! I am the developer of Journey and founder of the AngelMaker design team. I have a strong belief in producing free apps and allowing each user to contribute the amount of money they want to the app developer. This is my first app and first published product but I plan to make more apps, some websites, and possibly a vr games in the future.

I would love to hear feedback about your experience with the app and any suggestions or criticisms! Please send an email to AngelMakerContact@gmail.com or leave a comment in the app store. I will be taking a break from this project for a few month but afterwards I will try to update the app with the top requested features and improvements.
